choices.D: alter account xy12345 add share my_share;
choices.B: grant select on share my_share to account xy12345;
choices.C: alter share my_share add accounts = xy12345;

Partner Connect is limited to account administrators (i.e. users with the ACCOUNTADMIN role) who have a verified email address in Snowflake: To use Partner Connect, you must switch to the ACCOUNTADMIN role or contact someone in your organization who has the role.

Selected Answer: A
Right Answer

questions.question_text: What role is required to use Partner Connect?

discussion.content: multi-cluster warehouse is the solution for simultaneous querying.

Selected Answer: C
Use Multi-Cluster Warehouses for concurrency

Selected Answer: C
Multi-cluster warehouses are best utilized for scaling resources to improve concurrency for users/queries. They are not as beneficial for improving the performance of slow-running queries or data loading. For these types of operations, resizing the warehouse provides more benefits.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-multicluster

comments.content: A - you are not adding WH to multi -cluster

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Multi cluster enables multi users

questions.question_text: How can a Snowflake user configure a virtual warehouse to support over 100 users if their company has Enterprise Edition?

choices.A: Add additional warehouses and configure them as a cluster.

choices.D: The text data in a micro-partition is compressed with GZIP but other types are not compressed.
choices.C: The micro-partitions are stored in compressed cloud storage and the cloud storage handles compression.
choices.B: Each micro-partition is compressed as it is written into cloud storage using GZIP.
choices.A: Each column is compressed as it is stored in a micro-partition.

questions.question_text: How is table data compressed in Snowflake?

discussion.content: Answer is A

shoul be A.

Snowflake automatically determines the most efficient compression algorithm for the columns in each micro-partition.

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tables-clustering-micropartitions#what-are-micro-partitions

Selected Answer: A
COLUMNAR FORMAT

When data is loaded into Snowflake, Snowflake reorganizes that data into its internal optimized, compressed, columnar format. Snowflake stores this optimized data in cloud storage.

Snowflake manages all aspects of how this data is stored â€” the organization, file size, structure, compression, metadata, statistics, and other aspects of data storage are handled by Snowflake. The data objects stored by Snowflake are not directly visible nor accessible by customers; they are only accessible through SQL query operations run using Snowflake.
c is the answer. "100 Rows" will return 100 rows. 100 is the probability. so all columns will be returned.

Correct answer is : C
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/constructs/sample
Return an entire table, including all rows in the table:
SELECT * FROM testtable TABLESAMPLE (100);

Selected Answer: C
Sample keyword can be used in two ways:
100 = 100% probability, all rows 
100 ROWS = only 100 rows returned

Selected Answer: C
It is the percentage of rows from table 100 means 100 percent so full table

The TABLESAMPLE clause in the query specifies that the result set should contain a random sample of data from the table, with the percentage specified as 100. This means that the entire table will be included in the result set, but the order of the rows will be random.

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/constructs/sample

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
num specifies the number of rows (up to 1,000,000) to sample from the table. Can be any integer between 0 (no rows selected) and 1000000 inclusive.

Correct :C,https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/constructs/sampleReturn an entire table, including all rows in the table:

SELECT * FROM testtable TABLESAMPLE (100);

questions.question_text:
What will be the output of the below query against the table name gold_data?

select * from gold_data tablesample (100);

choices.B: It will return a random 100 rows.
choices.D: It will produce an error message.
choices.A: It will return an empty sample.
choices.C: It will return an entire table.
